reviewText: WWF Breakdown was held September 1998 at Hamilton's Copps Coliseum.  Every major WWF superstar took part in this event.  The main event was a Triple Threat Match for the WWF Title.  Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin vs.  Undertaker vs. Kane.  This is the first time that the WWF Champion lost his  title at an In Your House event.  However, the best match was the Triple  Threat Steel Cage Match between The Rock, Mankind, and Ken Shamrock.  The  winner becomes the number one contender for the WWF Championship.  Other  matches include:  Edge vs. Owen Hart, D-Lo Brown vs. Gangrel, X-Pac and the  New Age Outlaws vs. Jeff Jarrett and Southern Justice, and many more...  Since I was at this event, I got to experience it the way it was meant to  be.  LIVE!!!  WWF Breakdown is a must-see for any true WWF fan.
summary: WWF Title changes hands first time at In Your House!!!
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS

reviewText: Now Capitol carnage was good but man.This is a video for hardcore wwf fans.The Mankind,Shammrock,and Rock match probably took a while to think up.
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS

reviewText: Every since Steve Austin won the WWF title at Wrestlemania 14 Vince McMahon has tried to 'mold' his new champion, trying to re-shape him into a  more flexiable corporate Rattlesnake. But each attempt failed. So Vince  McMahon has revealed his Masterplan to rid the WWF of the Texas  Rattlesnake. Kane and Undertaker - the single most destructive force in the  history of the WWF - have formed a deadly alliance. Led by McMahon the two  have set their sights on Austin and more importantly the WWF title. All  they have to do is co-exist for twenty minutes and destroy Stone Cold. But  when a beaten and semi-conscious Austin lays flat on his back in the middle  on the ring, the demonic brothers begin arguing over who should get the  pin... the main event is the only appealing match on the card, as is often  the case, this video serves merely as a stepping stone between two  storylines. Not very good viewed on it's own but a great build up to the  next pay-per-view: Judgment Day.
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS

reviewText: Hell out there it's time for me to go back & review an old wrestling Pay Per View a few weeks ago or so I took a look at the awesome Summerslam 1998. Now I am going to review WWF Breakdown from September of 98. Now you had to have found this review randomly or you grew up watching wrestling around this time like me & want to hear what people think of these old shows or you never got to experience The Attitude Era & want to hear about the past. Before I get into this review I want to fill in what happened after Summerslam on a Special Saturday Night RAW on September 5th Vince McMahon put down Undertaker's effort at Summerslam he called The Undertaker & Kane p**y  s & that they couldn't scare children even. The Undertaker & Kane went after Vince McMahon & spent the rest of the show interfering & attacking random superstars. The next night on Sunday Night Heat Vince McMahon announced that The Undertaker & Kane would defend The WWF title against both The Undertaker & Kane at Breakdown. Then things went into The Vince Russo layered storyline route cause on The September 13th episode of Sunday Night Heat Ken Shamrock said he wanted a shot at The WWF Championship. The next night on RAW IS WAR Vince McMahon added a stipulation that Undertaker & Kane can't pin each other in The Triple Threat Match. Also McMahon made a deal with Undertaker Kane for them to watch his back. McMahon made Austin defend the title against Ken Shamrock. While Kane was having a match against The Rock Mankind returned & hit Kane with a Sledgehammer. The Undertaker & Kane interfered in The WWF title match The Rock & Mankind came out & made the save. It continued into Sunday Night Heat when The Rock, Mankind & Ken Shamrock jumped The Undertaker & Kane. McMahon had them leave the arena & the next night on RAW IS WAR McMahon put The Rock, Ken Shamrock & Mankind in a Triple Threat Match to determine a NO ! Contender for The WWF title. McMahon put Austin in a Tag match against The Undertaker & Kane neither The Rock, Ken Shamrock & Mankind could help Austin if they wanted to become NO 1 Contender. Billy Gunn joined Austin to face Undertaker & Kane they lost though. The Undertaker & Kane interfered in The NO 1 Contenders Triple Threat Match & beat everybody down but Austin attacked Vince McMahon to close the show. On The September 14th episode of RAW IS WAR Val Venis revealed to Dustin Rhodes that his Wife Terri & him were having an affair. On The September 21st X Pac defeated D'lo Brown to become The WWF European Champion & The WWF Women's Championship was brought back & Jacqueline defeated Sable to win it. That is the backstory leading into this event. The buyrate was an 0.86 that is up from Ground Zero In Your House which got a 0.45.The current champions at the time in The WWF wereWWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin June 29th 1998WWF Intercontinental Champion Triple H August 30th 1998WWF European Champion X Pac September 14th 1998 match aired September 21st 1998WWF Tag Team Champions The New Age Outlaws Road Dogg & Billy Gunn August 30th 1998WWF Women's Champion Jacqueline September 14th match aired September 21st 1998WWF Lightheavyweight Champion Taka Michinoku December 7th 1997Date September 27, 1998Attendance 17,405Venue Copps ColiseumCity Hamilton, OntarioHeatVince McMahon came out announced that The Rock, Mankind & Ken Shamrock will face each other at Breakdown in a Steel Cage Match. He added a stipulation to The Triple Threat WWF Championship match that if anyone interfere's that he will have the match stopped & Austin will be stripped of the title.Golga with The Oddities Def Mosh with Thrasher DUDA bit of backstory to this match is that on The September 21 episode of RAW The Headbangers turned heel & attacked The Oddities & they ripped up Golga's stuffed Cartman doll.In The back Michael Cole announced that Triple H has been attacked.Mark Henry came out he cut a promo on Triple H saying he wanted to face Triple H & win The Intercontinental Championship & impress his fans, his Mom watching in Silsby TX & to impress his Girlfriend Chyna. He said he's going home. Vince McMahon came out & told him that he can still compete & he would face Stone Cold in a Steel Cage to find out if it's reinforced or not.The Hardy Boyz Matt & Jeff Def Kaientai Funaki & Teioh with Mr Yamaguchi San *Triple Threat Match8 Ball Def Billy Gunn & Skullthis was punishment for Billy Gunn helping Austin on RAW. The DOA kept beating on Billy Gunn X Pac & Road Dogg came out to make the save.Vince McMahon came out with The Undertaker & KaneChyna beat the crap out of Mark Henry in the backwhen the cage was being set up Austin who was disguised as a ring crew member attacked Vince McMahon.A really good video package was shown for The Triple Threat WWF title matchVince McMahon was yelling & screaming that Austin leave with The WWF title tonight as Heat went off the airThe opening was very goodOwen Hart Def Edge ** & half of a star a decent matchthis is the only time Owen Hart & Edge went at it on a Pay Per View to memory & Christian made his 1st WWF appearance.Al Snow & 2 Cold Scorpio Def Too Much Brian Christopher & Scott Taylor **I forgot to tell in the backstory that on The September 21st episode of RAW IS WAR Al Snow was allowed to come back to The WWF when he beat Sergeant Slaughter in a Boot Camp Match.Michael Cole interviewed The Undertaker & Kane. The Undertaker said that it's nobody business who is going for the pinfall & that he & Kane have came to a understanding. He ended by saying this is going to be the total annihilation of 1 Stone Cold Steve Austin.Marc Mero with Jacqueline Def Droz * & quarter of a star Mero hit a Shooting Star Press to win this was a poor match thoughNO HOLDS BARREDBradshaw Def Vader * & half of a starthis felt like a RAW match for the most part & this was Vader last WWF appearance which Vader didn't do anything in 98.D'lo Brown Def Gangel ** in an ok matchduring the match Jerry Lawler mentioned that Canadians were so far behind the times that he saw someone with a Hulkamania sign. Jim Ross asked if he was playing the air guitar. After the match Gangrel spit red liquid into Mark Henry's eyes & laid D'lo Brown out.Michael Cole interviewed Ken Shamrock who said he came to The WWF to becoming The World Champion nothing else matters & said for The Rock & Mankind to knuckle up.Dok Hendrix interviewed The Rock & all I have to say is d  a  m  n! He cut a great promo.Kevin Kelly interviewed Mankind he was asked what he's looking in this match he said "An end to world hunger." He talked about stupid thing & he took a shot at then President Clinton. But nothing rivals the sheer stupidity of The People's Elbow.Triple Threat NO 1 Contenders Cage MatchThe Rock Def Ken Shamrock & Mankind *** a good match but that whole NO 1 Contenders thing didn't mean much cause of what happens later.a good ad was shown for Judgement Day In Your HouseA decent video package was shown for The Val Venis vs Dustin Rhodes matchVal Venis with Terri Def Dustin Rhodes ** Val Venis brought Terri with him6 Man Tag Team MatchD Generation XX PacRoad Dogg Jesse James& BA Billy GunnDefSouthern JusticeJeff JarrettMark Canterbury& Dennis Knight **a really good video package was shown for The Triple Threat WWF title matchWWF ChampionshipThe Undertaker & Kane pinned Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin at the same time The Undertaker & Kane weren't allowed pin each other title was vacated the next night on RAW IS WAR. ** & 3 quarters of a starthis was a more than decent Triple Threat or Handicap Match. Austin was mad he beat up McMahon's Stooges & chased McMahon to the parking lot where Vince yelled "You see this you don't have it anymore! YOU DON'T HAVE IT ANYMORE! IT'S MINE IT'S MINE!"This managed to be a good Pay Per View. This wasn't as good as Summerslam but Summerslam 98 was awesome cause it had 2 4 star main events 1 of them going to nearly 5 stars. a good opening match a good undercard some fun matches & a half decent Lions Den Match. This is a good show match of the night was no doubt The Triple Threat Cage Match with The Rock, Mankind & Mankind. The Triple Threat WWF title Match was more than decent although it took awhile for things to get going in that match. The opener was decent between Owen Hart & Edge which saw Christian's 1st appearance. No DUD's or half star matches on the card so that's good. If you see the tape in a Pawn Shop cheap go ahead & buy it or if you see for sell by a bootleg seller then I guess get it. Next review will be WWF Judgement Day In Your House.
summary: WWF Breakdown In Your House review 7.5/10
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS

reviewText: Breakdown: In Your HouseSeptember 27, 1998Copps ColiseumHamilton, Ontario, CanadaEdge V. Owen HartAwesome opener. I really don't like Edge was a performer, but if you get him in there that can carry his ass, he looks like a million bucks and that's what happened here. Owen...R.I.P. Buddy, you are truely missed. Owen wins and gives Edge his first **** star match.Too Much V. Al Snow & ScorpioThe JOB Squad won this match?...their Job IS to Job. Ok...whatever. ***No Holds Barred Match:Vader V. Bradshawok match that had some very good spots in it actually. Bradshaw wins ** and speaking of JOBS...is seems like since No Way Out Vader have been doing to JOB everytime he was on PPV. Weird.D'Lo Brown V. GangrelShort and thank god, Gangrel sucks. It's a good thing that D'Lo won. *1/2Triple Threat Steel Cage Match:Mankind V. The Rock V. ken ShamrockVery cool cage match. I wonder why Vince doesn't do more Triple Threat Cage Matches. I think it's unique. The Rock wins. ***3/4Val Venis V. Dustin RunnelsLook at what Terri isn't wearing. Very hott...AH, i just got slapped in the head by my wife...what I'm a guy..the day we stop looking is the day we die. It's the truth. Anyways, the match was ok and everyone was looking at Terri anyways so we are all winners. actually Val wins. **X-Pac & New Age Outlaws V. Jeff Jarrett & Southern JusticeGood match that could have been better. DX wins. ***Triple Threat Match for the WWF Championship:Stone Cold Steve Austin (Champion) V. Undertaker V. KaneOne of my favorite matches. Great storyline and both Undie and Kane pin Austin at the same time and Finkle doesn't know who to announce as the new champ. ****1/4Overall, a very good show with a very hott opener, two awesome triple threat matches and one very hott Terri Runnels as always.
summary: Two Triple Threat Matches On One Card...Sounds Good To Me!!!
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS

reviewText: WWF Breakdown was a great PPV. It was exciting from the opening match to the contreversial main event. Edge and Owen Hart face off in the Tortured Soul-vs-Sole Survivor match in which Christian makes his debut. Al Snow and Scorpio take on Too Much in a tag match. Marc Mero faces Droz and Gangrel takes on D'Lo Brown. Bradshaw and Vader have a match which is No-Holds Barred and Falls Count Anywhere. In the first of the 2 triple threat matches The Rock,Ken Shamrock,and Mankind wrestle in a cage. And in the main event Steve Austin takes on both Undertaker and Kane for the WWF Championship. It's a great match with a suprise ending. I think that is all the matches but if there is more I'm sorry for that. Just go buy the video.
summary: Breakdown made me breakdown with excitement
Title: WWF: In Your House 24 - Break Down VHS
